summary: The 'Streamlining FEMA Procurement Procedures Act of 2025' aims to allow local governments to use Construction Manager at Risk procurement methods when carrying out activities under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, specifically for projects under section 406. It mandates presidential regulations within 180 days of enactment. The bill also amends Section 422(a) of the Stafford Act, raising the simplified procedure threshold from $1,000,000 to $3,000,000.
